title: The Lorax
description: An immersive forest that demonstrates the negative impact of humans on an ecosystem.
author: Dr Suess
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VlmgIPxfRbs

content.caption: The world of The Lorax responds to user proximity. Truffula trees are felled by human presence.
The experience is a large space that allows users to freely wander around with adequate space for social distancing.
Truffula trees mechanically contract into stumps as a physical representation of environmental destruction. They will only regrow if left alone for a period of time.
Users are reminded to care about the world that they inhabit, for if they do not, no one will. These messages are only available once the trees are in a state of destruction.
Whisper-la phones remind users of the largest culprits in environmental damage.
These hand-held speaker sets are detachable from the tree and will tell the story of the Onceler.
Danny DeVito's narration will ring out when the trigger is pulled.
Users are able to donate $3.98 to plant a tree. This would also be the price to buy a Thneed.
One would pay with contactless payment and be able to write their name on a tag for a digital tree.
